Name: Princeton
Ingredients: 5 ml Sugar syrup 'rich' (2 sugar to 1 water, 65.0°Brix) optional
Instructions: Select and pre-chill a Coupe glass .
Prepare garnish of orange zest twist.
EXPRESS orange zest twist over the cocktail and use as garnish.
Review: Kappeler's 1895 recipe calls for the Old Tom gin and orange bitters to be stirred with ice and strained into a glass, with port poured down the side of the glass so it settles to form a red layer beneath the orange bitters tinted gin. I've added a spoon (5ml) of sugar syrup to Kappeler's recipe to slightly sweeten the gin (omit if using a sweet old tom) and a splash of water to add some much-needed dilution. I also prefer to abandon the original layering and stir all the ingredients together.
History: Adapted from a recipe in Harry Craddock 's influential 1930 The Savoy Cocktail Book .
Nutrition: One serving of Princeton contains 166 calories
